headline.main: LSU Says Ben Simmons Ineligible for Wooden Award
headline.print_headline: LSU Says Ben Simmons Ineligible for Wooden Award

docs.snippet: LSU said Saturday that freshman Ben Simmons is ineligible for the John R. Wooden Award that will be presented to the nation's top player....
docs.lead_paragraph: LSU said Saturday that freshman Ben Simmons is ineligible for the John R. Wooden Award that will be presented to the nation's top player.

headline.main: Bergdahl Lawyers Seek Meeting With Trump Over Statements
headline.print_headline: Bergdahl Lawyers Seek Meeting With Trump Over Statements

docs.snippet: Attorneys for Army Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl said Saturday they may seek a deposition from presidential contender Donald Trump or call him as a witness at a legal proceeding, saying they fear his comments could affect their client's right to a fair trial...
docs.lead_paragraph: Attorneys for Army Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl said Saturday they may seek a deposition from presidential contender Donald Trump or call him as a witness at a legal proceeding, saying they fear his comments could affect their client's right to a fair trial.

headline.main: No. 19 Spartans Stun No. 9 Buckeyes 82-63 in Big Ten Tourney
headline.print_headline: No. 19 Spartans Stun No. 9 Buckeyes 82-63 in Big Ten Tourney

docs.snippet: Aerial Powers scored 31 points and Tori Jankoska added 23 to help No. 19 Michigan State rout No. 9 Ohio State 82-63 in the second Big Ten tournament semifinal Saturday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Aerial Powers scored 31 points and Tori Jankoska added 23 to help No. 19 Michigan State rout No. 9 Ohio State 82-63 in the second Big Ten tournament semifinal Saturday.

docs.snippet: BALLON--Harriet. Died on March 5 at 86. The daughter of Ruth and Harry Milk, she was blessed by two beautiful marriages, to Charles Ballon for 40 years, and after his death to Harvey Lucks for 17 years. A woman of great warmth, generosity, and bea...
docs.lead_paragraph:
BALLON--Harriet.

Died on March 5 at 86. The daughter of Ruth and Harry Milk, she was blessed by two beautiful marriages, to Charles Ballon for 40 years, and after his death to Harvey Lucks for 17 years. A woman of great warmth, generosity, and beauty, she was full of passion for politics, sports, and her family on whom her life centered: her devoted children Howard, Hilary, and Carla Gorrell whom she showered with boundless love; their spouses Joan, Orin Kramer, and Mick Gorrell whom she loved as her own children; and her treasured grandchildren David and Jason Ballon, Sophie and Charles Kramer, and Elizabeth, James, Alison, and Sarah Gorrell. Harriet's love embraced Debra Norvell, a remarkable woman who enriched her life for 34 years, cherished lifelong friends, and Harvey's children Susan, Stuart and Sara Lucks who welcomed Harriet into their family.

docs.snippet: HINCK--Joanna Marie "Joy," died on March 2, 2016. She was 49. Joy is survived by her father and stepmother, Henry and Pearl Hinck and by her sister and brother-in-law, Kate and Mike Khavari, and her nephew and niece, Ali and Sarah Khavari....
docs.lead_paragraph:
HINCK--Joanna Marie

"Joy," died on March 2, 2016. She was 49. Joy is survived by her father and stepmother, Henry and Pearl Hinck and by her sister and brother-in-law, Kate and Mike Khavari, and her nephew and niece, Ali and Sarah Khavari.

docs.snippet: KOBLICK--Joan Lesser. Died suddenly on February 6, 2016. Born NYC, March 28, 1932. Washington Irving high school '49; BFA Pratt Institute '53. Painter and printmaker, taught art and art history at University of Chicago Lab Schools for 31 years. Mu...
docs.lead_paragraph: KOBLICK--Joan Lesser. Died suddenly on February 6, 2016. Born NYC, March 28, 1932. Washington Irving high school '49; BFA Pratt Institute '53. Painter and printmaker, taught art and art history at University of Chicago Lab Schools for 31 years. Much loved and missed.

docs.snippet: ZELENITZ--Gertrude. Nee Bernstein. Born in West New York, NJ, June 30, 1922, died March 3, 2016, in Los Angeles, CA, surrounded by her family. Beloved sister, mother, grandmother, great-grandmother and aunt. Paul Bernstein Robin Ellen Zelenitz Gra...
docs.lead_paragraph:
ZELENITZ--Gertrude. Nee Bernstein. Born in West New York, NJ, June 30, 1922, died March 3, 2016, in Los Angeles, CA, surrounded by her family. Beloved sister, mother, grandmother, great-grandmother and aunt.

Paul Bernstein Robin Ellen Zelenitz Grant

docs.snippet: FRANK--Arnold, of West Palm Beach and Jericho, NY died peacefully on March 3, 2016. Beloved husband of Sandy, father of Larry, Linda and Bruce, grandfather of seven, uncle of eight and friend to all. Storyteller bar none. He will be sorely missed!...
docs.lead_paragraph:
FRANK--Arnold,

of West Palm Beach and Jericho, NY died peacefully on March 3, 2016. Beloved husband of Sandy, father of Larry, Linda and Bruce, grandfather of seven, uncle of eight and friend to all. Storyteller bar none. He will be sorely missed!

docs.snippet: HEINE--Andrew Noah, passed away peacefully in his home on February 26th at the age of 87. He will be missed dearly by his children Nancy Heine (Madrid, Spain), Priscilla Heine (East Hampton, New York), Jonathan Heine (Los Angeles, California), Ada...
docs.lead_paragraph:
HEINE--Andrew Noah,

passed away peacefully in his home on February 26th at the age of 87. He will be missed dearly by his children Nancy Heine (Madrid, Spain), Priscilla Heine (East Hampton, New York), Jonathan Heine (Los Angeles, California), Adam Heine (Bedford, New York) and Jake Heine (New York City), his daughter and sons- in-law Deborah Heine, Jose Cedillo and Cristobal Majcherski, his six grandchildren Ana, Sara, Tomas, Alejo, Sam and Jessica as well as his three great-grandchildren Diego, Julia and Leo. We will remember and cherish you always for your wry sense of humor and undisputed charm.

docs.snippet: GERLI--Anne. We are deeply saddened by the passing of Anne Gerli, beloved member of The Skating Club of New York for over 80 years and US Figure Skating Hall of Fame recipient. Anne was an inspiration to all, giving her time and talent to the spor...
docs.lead_paragraph:
GERLI--Anne.

We are deeply saddened by the passing of Anne Gerli, beloved member of The Skating Club of New York for over 80 years and US Figure Skating Hall of Fame recipient. Anne was an inspiration to all, giving her time and talent to the sport she loved. She championed the skater, regardless of level. Her most memorable contributions were the establishment of the Junior National Championships and the Young Internationals program that in its first year sent future Olympic Champions Sarah Hughes and Evan Lysacek to compete internationally. Always the voice of reason and blending history while simplifying issues with wisdom and a wry sense of humor. Her passing represents the end of an era, but she has left a rich legacy and we will forever be blessed to have known her. The Skating Club of New York
